title: Animal Tracks of the Southwest Playing Cards (Nature's Wild Cards)
features: Play Cards and Learn to Identify Mammal Tracks in the Southwestern United States!
Anyone who enjoys nature, wildlife, and the great outdoors will love these cards for playing your favorite games or to use as flash cards. Inspired by Jonathan Poppele’s popular

quick guide, this gorgeous deck of playing cards features detailed illustrations of 54 of the most notable mammal tracks in the Southwestern states of Arizona, Colorado, Nevada, New Mexico, Oklahoma, and Utah, as well as southern California and western Texas. Each card depicts realistic tracks of such animals as the Bobcat, Prairie Dog, Ringtail, and more—along with range maps—so you can begin to learn what 54 different animal prints look like.
54 of the most notable mammal tracks
54 of the most notable mammal tracks
Ideal for card games or as flash cards

Play games like blackjack, poker, rummy, and solitaire while learning more about tracking. Get
Animal Tracks of the Southwest Playing Cards
for yourself, and you can also give this deck of cards as a fun and thoughtful gift.
description: Jonathan Poppele is a naturalist, author, and educator with wide-ranging interests. He earned a master's degree in Conservation Biology from the University of Minnesota, studying citizen science, environmental education, and how to cultivate a personal relationship with the natural world through animal tracking. He has taught ecology, environmental studies, biology, and technical writing at the University of Minnesota. An avid outdoorsman and student of natural history, Jon is a member of the Minnesota Trackers Club and the International Society for Professional Trackers, and he is the founder of the Minnesota Wildlife Tracking Project. A Black Belt in the peaceful martial art of Ki-Aikido, Jon is also the founder and director of the Center for Mind-Body Oneness in Saint Paul, Minnesota.
